item.title: Buzz Williams' Texas A&M challenge: 'I still think that I have an edge'
item.description: If Buzz Williams is to succeed at Texas A&M, his relationships and organizational obsessiveness will likely play key roles in the Aggies' ascent.

item.title: Oregon up, Arizona down in Way-Too-Early Top 25 for 2019-20
item.description: The shifting sands of the Pac-12's preseason pecking order are a prominent feature of the latest Way-Too-Early Top 25.

item.title: Middle Tennessee's Dishman out for season
item.description: Middle Tennessee forward DeAndre Dishman will miss the 2019-20 season after tearing ligaments in his left knee during the Blue Raiders' exhibition tour of Costa Rica last week.

item.title: Guard Patterson reclassifies for '19; picks Oregon
item.description: Addison Patterson, ranked No. 31 in the ESPN 100 for the 2020 class, has reclassified to 2019 and committed to Oregon.

item.title: Filings suggest Nike paid in pursuit of players
item.description: Newly released emails and text messages in the case against attorney Michael Avenatti suggest that Nike officials were making under-the-table payments to handlers and families of top college basketball prospects.

item.title: Avenatti filing: Nike OK'd payments to Zion, more
item.description: Attorneys representing Michael Avenatti filed a motion Wednesday that alleges that a Nike employee at least approved payments to former Duke star Zion Williamson and former Indiana star Romeo Langford when they were still in high school in February 2017.

item.title: Pitino's lawyers ask to reopen discovery in lawsuit
item.description: Lawyers for former Louisville basketball coach Rick Pitino have asked a judge to reopen discovery in his lawsuit against the university's athletics association after an allegation that a former trustee was the "cash source" for payments to strippers.

item.title: 3 convicted in NCAA pay-for-play trial file appeal
item.description: Attorneys representing former Adidas executive James Gatto, Adidas consultant Merl Code and aspiring business manager Christian Dawkins have filed an appeal claiming their clients might have broken NCAA rules but didn't commit federal crimes.

item.title: Ollie gets win over UConn in one arm of dispute
item.description: An arbitrator ruled in favor of Kevin Ollie in saying the former basketball coach is protected by a union contract when it comes to the burden of proof UConn must meet to justify Ollie's firing.

item.title: Does N'Faly Dante signing make Oregon a top-10 team?
item.description: Oregon's signing of N'Faly Dante completes its wholesale offseason transformation into the Pac-12's team to beat.

item.title: Why 15-year-old Emoni Bates is basketball's next phenomenon
item.description: Emoni Bates just completed his freshman year of high school. He's in the conversation among the best prep prospects since LeBron James.

item.title: Chasing Ghosts: Adolph Rupp built Kentucky, and his legacy persists
item.description: Adolph Rupp won four NCAA titles at Kentucky. No one else has more than one ... but John Calipari is making a serious run at Rupp's legacy.

item.title: How Evan Mobley helps transform USC basketball
item.description: Evan Mobley has skills that evoke former No. 1 NBA pick Ralph Sampson. But how soon will we see the newest USC Trojan at the next level?

item.title: The biggest challenge for every new coach in college basketball
item.description: With the coaching carousel finally at rest (we think), here's the toughest task for each of the 59 new Division I bosses.

item.title: Q&A: Virginia's Tony Bennett on recruiting, transfer rules and a title's impact
item.description: Tony Bennett sat down with ESPN to discuss the road ahead for Virginia after winning the national title.

item.title: College basketball coaching changes for 2019-20
item.description: An up-to-date list of every coaching change in college basketball entering the 2019-20 season.

item.title: College basketball transfer rankings for 2019-20 and 2020-21
item.description: It's college basketball's version of free agency. We've ranked the top players who are set to switch schools this offseason.

item.title: ESPN 2020 basketball recruiting player rankings
item.description: Cade Cunningham moves up to No. 2 in the latest ESPN 100 update for 2020.
